page.title: 20Two Schools in Meden Vale.
page.content: Eastlands School was built in 1924 to receive all the children of school age in Meden Vale _then called Welbeck Colliery Village.Later children of secondary school age were transferred to secondary modern school in nearby Warsop.Eastlands took all 5_11year old children until 1966 when the neighbouring Netherfield Infant School was built.Eastlands roll was once 250 _300 children but is at present 140. The building has 8 rooms_5 teaching areas,1 parents'room,a library and a craft room.Netherfield had 65 on roll to begin with and now has 85 plus 60 children in the Nursery which was built about 7 years ago just after a fire destroyed part of the building. Over 90% of the children of both schools stay at school for dinner.The Junior School has 2 Gym Clubs,a Craft Club,Netball,Football,and Book Clubs.
